dialogues.text: (to others) Let’s go. They exit the room, Todd in the lead. Sam, lying on the b unbuttons his shirt and pushes it open. He pulls back the bandage to look at his wound. The area around where the bullet entered is red and swollen, and the skin around it purple and glossy. Sam touches his chest, near the wound, and flinches. He l back in the bed and closes his eyes, sweating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William, Annabelle and Todd walk out onto the front porch The wind tears at the branches of a tree in front of them

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: This is turning out to be a hell of a night.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: No kidding. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: William steps off the porch, then bends down, picks up a and throws it into the field.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Christ. A drop of rain falls and hits William’s forehead. He look at the sky as more raindrops plunk onto the ground around him.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s great. William turns back to look at Annabelle and Todd, who are still on the porch, protected from the rain.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m gonna look around a little.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I’1l go with you.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Yeah, I might look around myself.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: No, somebody should stay up in the front room, in case anyone comes back or tries to get into the house. (pause) Speaking of which... where’s Clyde?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Oh, god.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: He was going to the outhouse.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: You’d think he’d be done by now. Stay here. William and Annabelle walk around to the side of the hous as Todd steps back into the front room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is raining harder as William and Annabelle walk back towards the barn. The rain splatters off William’s hat an has soaked Annabelle’s hair and dress.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: William? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: William stops and looks at her. ANNABELLE (CONT’D) It’s just... (pause) There’s something wrong here. I know it. We should leave. William looks up into the rain.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Not much chance of that now. Besides, we can’t just leave Joseph here. He could have just gone for a walk.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: He didn’t just go for a walk, William! William looks somewhat taken aback by the panic in Annabelle’s voice. He reaches out hesitantly and touches arm.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I’m... I’m sorry. But, I mean... You feel it, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Uh, I can’t say that I do. Not really. I mean, weird stuff’s been going on, and Maybe someone’s messing with us, but... He trails off as Annabelle shakes her head. WILLIAM (CONT’D) What? Annabelle shakes her head again.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Nothing. I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Come here. Annabelle moves closer to him and he embraces her. They h each other in the pouring rain, then William moves away f Annabelle, smiling at her.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, look... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Annabelle looks over William’s left shoulder, her eyes widening. William whirls around. Clyde is standing behind him, scowling. The light of Clyd lantern is subdued by the rain.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Clyde! Good god, man. We were worried you’d fallen in.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Did you guys see Joseph come by here?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Well, no, we didn’t. Clyde squints into the nearby cornfield.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: I could’ve sworn I saw him moving around in there. Annabelle and William look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Are you sure it was him? I mean, I can barely see the stalks.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I saw a head and shoulders moving around in the rows, but then...

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Well, then I didn’t see him anymore. (pause) It was either him, or something else real big. There is a short silence while they consider this.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Well, I don’t think they have bears down here, so it was probably Joseph. I bet he’s playing some sort of game.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I might have had a run-in with Dog earlier, too. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It could have just been a raccoon, I guess. Whatever it was, it ran off before I could get my hands on it.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: That’s good news. I was worried Dog might’ve spooked off for good. William looks at Annabelle, smiling optimistically. Annab returns a faint smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd sits at the table, in front of several stacks of gol coins. Todd drinks from a bottle of whiskey. A sudden noise comes from the hallway nearby. Todd starts then looks into the hallway, seeing nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam lies in bed, sweating, looking up at the ceiling. He looks down at the foot of his bed. As Sam watches, the older boy child, the same one that Annabelle saw, slowly rises up from the foot of the bed a looks at Sam, putting his hands on the mattress. The boy’ eyes and mouth are dark holes. Sam stares at the boy, frozen with fear. The older boy addresses Sam calmly:

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BOY
dialogues.text: My parents used to lie together in this bed. This is where my mother was when the consumption took her. The boy looks down at the floor, then crouches down benea the bed, disappearing from Sam’s view. Sam squeezes his e shut, pulling the blankets up around his neck. Sam begins quickly muttering to himself, an incoherent li of barely audible prayers.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Our father who art in heaven, hallowed be thy name... Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I shall fear no evil, for thou art with me. Thy kingdom come, thy will be done. Amen. When Sam opens his eyes, a large man is standing in the corner of the room, barely visible in the darkness. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The man is holding a long object, obscured by the shadows one hand. The FATHER speaks, possibly to himself:

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: I had to do it. If I hadn’t done it, it would have been so much worse for them. I put them where they’1l never be found, by anyone. You understand, don’t you? The man steps forwards slightly. The object in his hand i small, bloody scythe. The man’s head is lowered. FATHER (CONT’D) Tell me you understand. Sam, trembling with fright, tries to speak

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Sure... Sure, I understand. The man stops. Then he slowly turns and looks at Sam.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Who are you? Where is she? Sam shuts his eyes again and begins muttering inarticulat to himself. The room is silent. Sam slowly opens his eyes The man is standing above Sam, leaning over the bed. The raises his scythe above his head.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I asked you a question! Sam screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William, Clyde and Annabelle walk through the rain, up to front porch.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Well, what now?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t mind getting some rest. Anyone else for that? Annabelle laughs drily.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You can count me out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Well, sit up with Todd then. I’1l sit with you guys for a second, then I’m going to get some shut-eye.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: I guess I could use it. They walk into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William, Annabelle and Clyde step into the front room, looking around. The gold is still piled on the table. Tod steps out from the kitchen, holding his lantern.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What’re you up to?

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Thought I heard a noise back here, near the basement door. Guess I was wrong. Anything happening?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Not that I can see. Clyde here says he saw Joseph and Dog.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Or at least it was some kind of animal.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: You should’ve shot it. Then at least we'd have something fresh to eat. William sits down on the floor, heavily, and begins rolli cigarette. Annabelle sits down next to William. She reach for the book, flips through it, then sets it back down on table. She then lightly rests her head on William’s shoul

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Roll me one.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Sure thing. Clyde sits down at the table with Todd, who shifts the de of cards over towards him. Clyde begins shuffling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde throws down five cards, disgusted. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: I swear you’re cheating. Todd lifts a finger to his lips, tilting his head over towards William and Annabelle, who are fast asleep on the floor. Annabelle is curled up next to William, who is sti sitting against the wall, his mouth slightly open, breath deeply.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Shhh. You’11 wake the dead with your pernicious lies. Clyde grins at William and Annabelle.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Aw, ain’t they sweet? Clyde yawns and arches his back. CLYDE (CONT’D) I’m getting a little weary myself.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Sure you are. Or maybe you don’t want to lose any more gold?

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Ah, you’re just scared to stand watch alone.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Nonsense.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: You gonna let me get some sleep, then?

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Sure. I think you could use it. You’re getting grouchy. Clyde looks at Todd askance, then rises from the table an begins moving towards the stairs. TODD (CONT’D) You’re sleeping upstairs?

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: They got beds there, don’t they?

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I guess. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Clyde shrugs and climbs the stairs. Todd puts down his ca and looks out into the rain. INT. CHILD’S BEDROOM - LATE EVENING Clyde walks into the dark bedroom. He walks over to one o the beds, leans down and knocks a doll off of it. The dol hits the ground and rolls over, onto its back, staring up the ceiling with painted eyes. Clyde scowls at it, then s his lantern down next to the bed. Clyde lies down on the bed, which he is slightly too larg for, and pulls an old, torn blanket up over the lower hal his body. He then bends down and turns the lantern down l Clyde curls up and shuts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd flips a gold coin languidly across the fingers of on hand, looking slowly around the room. He yawns, then pull out his gun and begins cleaning it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William and Annabelle are still asleep, in the same positions. At the table, Todd’s head is resting on one ha his arm propped up on the table. The lantern next to him been turned down low. Todd blinks, very slowly. His eyelids close, then he open his eyes wide, looking around quickly. Nothing in the roo different. Todd’s eyes slowly start to shut again. He blinks twice, his eyelids close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thumping noise comes from beyond the kitchen. Todd’s ey fly open and he sits up straight, looking towards the kitchen. Todd swiftly surveys the room, then slumps back in his ch rubbing at his face. The noise comes again, from somewhere on the other side o the house, and Todd jumps to his feet, his eyes narrowed. Todd looks down at William and Annabelle, who are still asleep. He then walks past them, into the kitchen.  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd walks through the dark kitchen, holding his lantern one hand, his gun in the other. He walks into the corrido stopping near the door to the basement. Todd looks around. The windows facing outside are dark though the sound of the rainstorm can still be heard. The wind whistles and rain splatters against the glass windowpanes. Todd turns around and faces the door to the basement. He the handle to his lantern between his teeth, reaches down grips the doorknob. Slowly, Todd turns the doorknob. Todd pushes on the door. It does not budge. He leans agai the door, still holding onto the doorknob, but the door w not move. Todd sighs and releases the doorknob. He steps across the corridor, to one of the windows. Todd raises his lantern, only illuminates the water against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd moves his face closer to the glass, but cannot see anything in the darkness outside; all he can see is his reflection in the window. Todd stares at his reflection brushing slightly at his hair. Just then, lightning flashes, illuminating the outside wo Sam is facing the other side of the window, looking in at Todd from the outside. Todd jumps back with a yell as the sound of thunder cracks against the house. On the outside of the house, Sam’s face is directly in fr of Todd’s, looking straight into Todd’s eyes, twisted int mask of hate. They are separated only by the pane of glas Sam’s hair is matted and his clothes are drenched by the rain. Sam runs to the side, then the outside world goes dark ag as the lightning ends. Todd fumbles with his lantern, tur it up higher, and holds it to the window. He can see noth outside. Todd pants, catching his breath. He moves over to another window, calling out:

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Sam! There is no response. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TODD (CONT’D) (to himself) What the hell... (shouting) What the hell are you doing out there? Only the sound of the rain can be heard. Thunder rumbles slightly, far off. TODD (CONT’D) (to himself) What the hell is he doing? Todd walks back towards the kitchen. Just as he passes th door to the basement, a loud thumping sound comes from against the other side of the basement door, as if a pers were throwing their body against it. There is a stifled whimper, like a person in pain, from the other side of th door, then silence. Todd jumps back, staring at the basement door, his eyes w The sound does not come again. Todd looks around. TODD (CONT’D) Sam? Todd moves slowly towards the basement door. Holding his out, with his lantern between his teeth, he again turns t doorknob and shoves. The door to the basement swings open. Todd steps away fro the door, raising his gun. Nothing but darkness is visibl TODD (CONT’D) Alright. Come on out, now. There is no sound from the basement. Todd steps forward a pushes the door open further with his foot. He holds his lantern forward. The basement steps are visible, but there is no one on th Todd sticks his head into the doorway, looking around. After a moment, he begins walking down the stairs, slowly The wooden steps creak as Todd moves down them. INT. CHILD’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Clyde lies still in the small bed, quietly breathing. Fro across the room, the sound of a female child softly sobbi can be heard. Clyde frowns in his sleep, shakes his head slightly, then opens his eyes, confused. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The sound of the child crying is coming from the corner o the room, which is not visible. Clyde frowns and looks around, blinking. He sits up in bed, rubbing his eyes. Clyde cannot see anything in the dark room. Carefully, without making a sound, he reaches down and turns up the lantern next to the bed. The older boy is standing immediately in front of Clyde, to the lantern. The boy’s eyes are completely black and h face is expressionless. Before Clyde can react, the boy l away from him and steps back into the darkness of the roo disappearing from sight. The crying sound continues.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: What- Who’s there? Clyde rapidly turns the lantern up all the way, illuminat most of the bedroom. His hand is unsteady and the lantern light sways as he sets the lantern back on the floor. The boy is nowhere to be seen. In the corner of the bedro a small girl is crouched, her arms around her knees, faci the corner. The girl is wearing only a pair of underwear. back, which is facing Clyde, trembles with her sobs. Clyde rubs his eyes, looks around again, then looks at th girl.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, how’d you get in here? Where’d that other kid go? The girl does not respond, continuing to face the corner cry. Clyde rises to his feet, standing next to the bed. CLYDE (CONT’D) Look here, are you okay? What’s the matter? The girl does not respond. Clyde moves closer to her, wal over to the corner. CLYDE (CONT’D) It’s okay, don’t cry. Tell me what’s wrong. Did that kid do something bad to you? You just tell me who did it, and I’ll take care of him, okay? Did something happen? The girl suddenly stands and whirls to face Clyde, who is only a couple of feet away from her. The girl’s ears are slightly pointed and her nose is unnaturally flat; (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: she has vertical pupils, like a cat, and her teeth are al inhuman, long and thin. There is a large, deep gash acros the front of the girl’s neck; her throat has been ripped away. The front of the girl’s body is soaked red with blo

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG GIRL
dialogues.text: (screams) My father did this! Clyde leaps backwards, stumbling, and falls onto the floo bumping his head. He jolts into a seated position, scooti desperately across the floor, away from the corner. The corner is empty. The girl is gone. Clyde stops, seeing this, and sits on the floor, leaning against the bed, breathing heavily. He looks quickly arou the room, reaching for his gun.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: What the... fucking hell... A shout comes from outside of the house.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, Clyde! Clyde looks up at the sound of Joseph’s voice. He rises t his feet and rapidly crosses over to the window. Lightnin flashes. Outside, just next to the cornfield, Joseph is standing, looking up at Clyde’s window. He is crouched over, hunche like an animal. Joseph looks up at Clyde over his shoulde out of the corners of his eyes. The lightning subsides an the yard goes dark again. Clyde lifts up the window sash, looking outside.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: (shouting) Joseph? Lightning flashes again. Joseph is visible in the cornfie about ten feet from where the field meets the yard, makin his way deeper into the cornfield, still hunched over unnaturally. Joseph is leaving a path of broken and smash cornstalks behind him. CLYDE (CONT’D) Joseph? Joseph does not look back. Clyde pauses, then turns and r out of the bedroom.  67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd reaches the bottom of the basement stairs, sweating. murmurs to himself, softly:

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I know you’re in here. The floor of the cellar is earth; the walls of the cellar comprised of damp stone. Todd holds both the lantern and out in front of his body, turning around, surveying the basement, which is too dark to see across. Todd begins to move past the staircase, keeping his back to the wall. In the center of the room, on the cracked, earthen floor, precise pentagram, approximately five feet in diameter, h been drawn in yellow paint or chalk. Inexplicable symbols surround the pentagram. Four posts have been driven into the floor along the circumference of the pentagram, forming a square. Above t pentagram, lines of rope have been hung from floorboards, if for drying food. Todd glances at this, then slowly moves to the other side the stairwell, still carefully keeping his back to the wa On the other side of the basement, the space is equally b Todd moves closer, looking around. Against the stone wall, a set of iron shackles, with cuff has been nailed into the stone. Todd frowns at this, then turns away. The only other object in the room is a short, squat woode chair. Todd moves closer to the chair, shining his lanter it. The chair has thick leather straps bound to its arms the two front chair legs. Next to the chair, on the floor, is a piece of hide, roll into a tube. Todd kicks lightly at the hide, unrolling it The hide contains several metal tools, all in various sta of decay and rust. Many of the tools are sharp and pointe Some are recognizable, such as a pair of pliers and a bal peen hammer, while others are not. Next to the chair, on the ground, lies a small, white obj Todd glances back at the chair, then kneels down and pick the object. It appears to be a broken piece of bone or to Todd drops it, disgusted. Todd quickly backs away from the chair, still peering aro the room, heading back towards the stairwell. A sharp voi suddenly comes from the other side of the cellar. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BLACK WOMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Help me! Todd jumps and spins around. On the floor, in the center the pentagram, a black woman is lying. Her wrists and ank are bound to the four posts. She looks over at Todd, straining her head to see him, tears in her eyes. BLACK WOMAN (CONT’D) Help me! Oh, god, please! The woman is wearing only a short, sloppy dress made out thick muslin; it barely covers her torso. Todd looks arou the room quickly. There is no one around except the two o them.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Who did this to you? How the hell did you get there?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK WOMAN
dialogues.text: Oh god, please help me. Please let me go! I didn’t do anything. I’11 never tell anyone about the others! Todd steps closer to the woman, frowning. She shrinks awa from him, constricted by her ropes.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: What’s going on here?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK WOMAN
dialogues.text: (shaking her head wildly) I didn’t see nothing! I didn’t see nothing! Todd starts to say something, stops, then walks over to t woman and kneels down next to her. He begins trying to un her hand from one of the posts, but seems to be having a difficult time with it. Suddenly Todd stops and stares.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Shit... You’re bound with dried rawhide. The woman’s hands are indeed swollen and purple. The rawh is cutting into the flesh of her wrists.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK WOMAN
dialogues.text: (whimpering) It hurts... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: (grim) I know it. (he stares at her) How long have you been down here?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK WOMAN
dialogues.text: (whispering) Please hurry. The black woman’s eyes dart around the room, looking for something.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Okay. I’m going to go to the other side of the stairwell and get something to try to cut this with... Todd trails off, as the woman has focused her eyes on something across the room from them. Her face is frozen i terror, her mouth open.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK WOMAN
dialogues.text: He’s here. Todd looks where she is looking. There is nothing there.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I don’t see anything. The woman ignores him. She is breathing quickly, her eyes still riveted on a spot about a yard in front of her legs There is still nothing visible there.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK WOMAN
dialogues.text: (whispering) Please... No... Todd looks around the room, his eyes narrowed. He rises t his feet. The woman is paralyzed with fear; tears run out of the corners of her eyes. She is now ignoring Todd completely, focusing her attention on the area opposite from them. Sh shakes her head, back and forth, but is quiet. Todd watches this, then quickly grabs his lantern and gun heads for the opposite side of the room, leaving the woma the floor. On the other side of the cellar, Todd reaches the chair a kneels down next to it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly Todd freezes. Very slowly, he looks up at the ch in front of him. It is empty. Todd shivers, then shakes h head and begins rooting through the rusted tools. Todd comes across a serrated, thin blade, with a curved handle. He grabs this and a pair of shears. Todd stands a walks over towards the stairwell, holding out his lantern Todd stops as soon as he enters the other side of the basement. The woman is still there, lying in the pentagra but now her back is arched. The front of her dress has be cut open to expose her stomach and torso. The woman’s eyes lock onto Todd’s. As Todd watches, froze thick cut appears on the side of the woman’s stomach. The continues across her belly, moving just above the navel, curved line under her ribs. The woman’s mouth opens and her eyes squeeze shut. It app that she is screaming in pain, but the only audible sound the room are Todd’s breathing and the sound of the woman’ skin and flesh separating. Blood wells out of the long cut on the woman’s stomach soaking into her dress and the dirt floor. She shakes her head wildly, her mouth still stretched open. As Todd watches, his eyes wide with horror, the cut in th woman’s stomach suddenly widens, as if it is being pushed open. From the open wound, the woman’s guts are roughly pulled from her body, straight into the air above her. He entrails hover above her stomach, dripping blood and flui The woman’s scream cuts through the air, a loud, awful sh of pain that tears through the quiet of the room. Blood splatters the floor as Todd turns and leaps away, t woman’s agonized screaming filling the basement. Todd’s f hit the first step of the basement stairs and he stumbles falling to his side, on the other side of the basement. Todd hits the ground hard, cracking his elbow against the wall and dropping his gun and lantern. The woman is still screaming. Todd’s lantern lies on its side in front of him. Todd rea for it, looking forward, towards the chair. As Todd’s eye meet with something in front of him, his face goes slack fear and he shrinks away, screaming, his back against the wall.  71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William and Annabelle are still asleep on the floor. The sound of footsteps running down the stairs comes from beh them. William opens his eyes and looks around the room, just as Clyde runs through the front room. Clyde grabs the front doorknob, opens it, and runs outside, into the storm.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What the hell... William rises up, rousing Annabelle, who looks up at him blearily.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Clyde just ran through here. I don’t know what he’s after. I’m gonna go check

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Okay. You do that. Annabelle immediately puts her head back down and closes eyes. William looks troubled.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Well, I don’t really want to leave you alone in here.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (mumbling) Don’t worry about it. I’1l be fine.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Well... William looks up suddenly. Sam is standing in the darknes the hallway, barely visible, his eyes glowing with the lantern light. His clothing is drenched. Sam stares at William without speaking.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sam! Good thing you’re up. Clyde just ran through here faster than lightning. William rises to his feet, rubbing the arm that he slept He looks around the room. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The gold is gone from the table; only the cards, whiskey bottles and book rest on the table.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Holy shit. The gold. William looks around the room again, quickly. The gold is nowhere to be seen. William looks back at Sam, his teeth bared.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hang in here just a second, watch over Annabelle. I’m going after Clyde. I’1l be right back. William turns away from Sam, who has not changed expressi and runs out the front door, shutting it behind him. Sam slowly steps out of the darkness of the hallway. He l down at Annabelle, his nostrils flaring slightly, then wa over to the table and lowers himself into a chair. Sam si staring straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William runs out into the rain, holding his lantern aloft Clyde is nowhere to be seen, but there is a spot in the r of corn, near the yard, where several stalks have been pu aside or trampled. William runs across the yard and into the cornfield. The broken stalks form a haphazard trail through the tall cor though William can still only see a couple feet in front himself, and cannot see over the corn. William continues staggering through the corn, along the trail, holding his lantern in front of him. William calls out:

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Clyde! Hey, Clyde! The sound of the rain splattering off the cornstalks drow out William’s voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits at the table. He has the book in his hands and f through the pages, pausing occasionally. After a moment, slowly looks down at Annabelle, sleeping on the floor

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Annabelle... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Annabelle stirs slightly on the floor SAM (CONT’D) Annabelle. She opens her eyes and looks up at Sam, squinting.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Sam? What are you doing? Sam does not respond for a moment, turning his attention to the book. ANNABELLE (CONT’D) What is it? What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I’m reading. Annabelle smiles at Sam, then, when he continues to look the pages of the book, frowns, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You’re reading that book?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yes. Annabelle straightens her back, tilting her head to see S better.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: What does it say?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It’s about how to contact the Old Ones.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: who? Sam's face darkens.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: The Old Ones, I said. Most think of them as spirits. They can walk between worlds and time is different for them. When they appear in our world, they mostly show themselves as animals, unless they are given greater power. Because they walk between worlds, their physical power is limited in each one. They should not be given mortal power, the power to change us, unless they can be controlled. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam smiles down at Annabelle, a haunted look in his eyes. smile trembles.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just got to that part. Annabelle rubs her eyes and speaks slowly.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Sam. What are you talking about? You’re not making any sense. Are you okay? Sam straightens up, his face blank, and sets down the boo the table.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: The hole in my shoulder hurts. I think something might be wrong. Annabelle sits up on the floor, stretching.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Well, you’d better let me take a look at it. Hang on. Annabelle unsteadily rises to her feet. She steps forward takes a seat at the table opposite from Sam. ANNABELLE (CONT’D) Can you unbutton your shirt? Sam reaches up and begins slowly unbuttoning his shirt. O he is finished, he pushes his shirt open and tears off th bandage. The area around Sam’s wound, expanding to cover most of h chest, is a black, swollen bruise. Thin tendrils of purpl infection crawl up Sam’s neck and down his stomach. The w itself is oozing a thick, viscous fluid. Annabelle shrinks away, holding her hand to her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It doesn’t smell so good, huh?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: My god... How long has it been like this? Sam shrugs slightly.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I don’t know. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Sam, we’ve- We’ve got to get you toa hospital. You’ve got some sort of infection. I don’t have anything here that can take care of it. Annabelle opens her bag and begins rooting through it. ANNABELLE (CONT’D) I might be able to give you something for the pain...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (smiles) It doesn’t hurt anymore, ‘Belle. Annabelle looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: What? What did you just say? Sam reaches forwards, towards Annabelle.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Here, I want to show you something.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: What is it? Sam holds out his hand to Annabelle.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Sam, I think you’re delirious. Hang on just a second, and I’1ll give you a shot that will make you feel a little better.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Okay. Sam lowers his head, looking down at the floor. He then l up at Annabelle. Sam’s green eyes are dark and his voice thick. SAM (CONT’D) Don’t you want to know what they did to me? Annabelle takes a glass vial from her bag, and begins dra fluid from the vial into a syringe. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You got shot, Sam. I was there, remember?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: The preacher said shooting’s too good for me. (Sam shows his teeth) They just left me up there to rot for what I did. Them and the Old Ones. They left me here. Forever. Annabelle taps the syringe.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about, Sam? Sam leans forward suddenly and grips Annabelle’s arm. His eyes are pale.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (hissing) Stop calling me that. Annabelle gasps, then blinks. Her eyes roll up into her h and her body goes rigid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the Father’s POV, the cornfield is upside-down and swaying from side to side, unevenly. A thick trail of blo runs from the Father’s nose into one of his eyes, filling eye with blood. The Father blinks rapidly. He is being dragged by his feet through the field. A group of men are dragging him through the neat cornfiel The Father, now fully visible, is the same man that Sam s up in the main bedroom. The Father tries to twist away fr the men, who drag him into a small clearing. The men release the Father’s legs; he curls up on the gro breathing heavily. A large fly settles on a bloody spot o the side of his face. He swats at the fly. Another group of men stand in the clearing, many of whom holding rifles. They stare at the Father, their faces twi with anger and disgust. In front of the men stands a PREACHER, wearing the formal attire of the cloth. Behind the men is a tall wooden cross, with a scarecrow attached to it, in a position to survey the cornfield. Th preacher addresses the Father. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PREACHER
dialogues.text: Where did you put the bodies? The Father is silent. One of the men who was holding him kicks the Father in the stomach. The Father curls up on t ground, gagging. PREACHER (CONT’D) Where are they? And where are your children? The Father coughs, choking out his words.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Where they belong. The preacher leans closer to the Father, staring into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PREACHER
dialogues.text: What happened to their mother? The Father looks away from him, then looks back into the preacher’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: They had no mother. Not that you’d know. A look of confusion passes over the preacher’s face. Then looks up and nods to one of the men. The man leans down with a burlap sack, pulling it over th Father’s head. The Father struggles.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! Goddamn you! What are you doing? One of the men, holding a rifle, quickly steps forward, aiming his rifle at the father.

dialogues.speaker: HYSTERICAL MAN
dialogues.text: Shut that sick bastard up! The preacher quickly reaches over and puts his hand on th barrel of the hysterical man’s rifle, aiming it away from Father.

dialogues.speaker: PREACHER
dialogues.text: Shooting’s too good for him. The man looks at the preacher. The preacher nods over to rest of the men. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PREACHER (CONT’D) Cut that scarecrow down. One of the men looks over at the preacher, then jumps up the cross with a knife and cuts the ropes binding the scarecrow. The scarecrow tumbles to the ground, falling t pieces, hay spilling out of its tight clothing. The preacher grits his teeth. PREACHER (CONT’D) Hoist him up there. A few of the men exchange glances, then move to follow th preacher’s order. Using ropes wrapped under the Father’s shoulders, the men pull him up onto the cross, using the arms of the cross a pulleys. Two men climb up onto the cross. Gripping the Father’s ar they bind him to the cross with loops of barbed wire, twisting the wire into knots with pliers. The Father struggles and kicks. Two men on the ground beg wrapping barbed wire around his legs. The father is tied tightly to the cross above them. The barbs dig into the f of his arms, legs and torso, raising dark droplets of blo The men step away from the cross, looking up at the strai figure of the Father. The Father twists against the cross but the wires around his body are tight. The burlap sack still covers his face. One of the men looks down at the crumpled, broken scarecr on the ground, then reaches down and picks up the scarecr hat.

dialogues.speaker: MAN WITH HAT
dialogues.text: Hang on a second. The man walks over to the cross, lifts himself up and pul the scarecrow’s hat down tightly over the top of the Fath twisting head. The man then drops off the cross and looks at the Father again.

dialogues.speaker: MAN WITH HAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There we go. With the hat and burlap sack over his head, the Father lo just like a scarecrow. The Father stops straining against ropes and hangs from the cross, his body limp. The preach addresses him: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PREACHER
dialogues.text: You still don’t want to tell us what you did with them? The Father hangs from the cross, silent PREACHER (CONT’D) Fine. We’ll see you get a little taste of hell in this world before you pass on to the next. You’1l answer to a higher form of justice than ours there. The Father’s voice is muffled by the burlap sack.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: I’m not going to die, if that’s what you’re hoping. The preacher looks up at him, then exchanges glances with several of the men.

dialogues.speaker: PREACHER
dialogues.text: We'll see about that. (to the men) Come on. The man who put the hat on the Father addresses the preac his voice subdued.

dialogues.speaker: MAN WITH HAT
dialogues.text: Do you want to search the house again? The preacher’s face is tense, with either fury or strain.

dialogues.speaker: PREACHER
dialogues.text: We’1l find nothing in there that we did not find before. Let us leave this place immediately. There is nothing more we can do. The man nods slightly, then the men and the preacher walk through the cornfield, away from the cross and the house. sun glares down on the field. Up on the cross, the Father begins vainly straining again the barbed wire again. In front of him, the men work thei way through the cornfield without looking back, the preac in the lead. The Father shakes his head vigorously, then screams, his shriek muffled by the burlap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A) A bloody, skinless figure, tied to the basement floor, twitches in a wide pool of blood. The Father’s scream is still audible. A shadow moves across the figure’s head, w the face used to be. B) A child’s eyes fly open. A large hand is clamped over child’s mouth. The child, a young boy, tries to yell, but cannot. The child has no eyelashes or eyebrows. C) By candlelight, the Father flips through pages of the book. He speaks unrecognizable syllables to himself as he reads, cutting at the top of his wrist with a knife. D) A closet door flies open. Inside the closet, the young girl is huddled, hiding in the clothes. She cowers away f the shadow that falls over her and makes a hissing sound. E) Blood flows across a wooden floor. The pool of blood s over towards a bed, underneath which a slightly older boy hiding, his eyes and mouth completely black. He is shakin and crying. The blood moves closer to the boy, who edges from it, trying to move soundlessly. Then a large boot st down into the pool of blood, directly in front of the boy F) A child’s body is dragged down the hallway; the child’ ankles, sliding along the floor, leave two trails of bloo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabelle jerks in her chair, staring around the room wil Across from her, Sam is slumped back in his chair, his ey shut. His arms hang limply at his sides. Annabelle scoots her chair away from the table and vomits onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William continues walking quickly through the cornstalks following the path of broken and bent stalks. Rain splatt off William’s hat. Suddenly, William is faced with tall, upright stalks in f of him. The only bent stalks are behind William. The trai has come to an abrupt end in the middle of the field. William looks around. There is nothing but cornstalks aro him, and no indication of Clyde or where he may have gone (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: William looks behind himself, at the bent cornstalks, but see nothing.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Clyde! where the fuck are you? William’s words are swallowed by the cornfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabelle jumps out of her chair as the front door opens William steps in. She then throws herself against him, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Jesus, honey. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I saw- I saw- I saw everything.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What did you see? Here, sit down. Annabelle sits back down in her chair, William’s hands on shoulders. William then notices Sam.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with Sam?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I- I don’t know... William reaches forward and shakes Sam’s arm, then shakes again, harder. Sam does not stir. William leans forward a pushes Sam’s shoulder. Sam slumps over onto the table. William slowly steps forward and puts his hand to Sam’s f He holds his hand against Sam’s unmoving face for several seconds, then William bows his head slightly.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: He’s... He’s dead. Annabelle quickly puts her fingers to the side of Sam’s n Sam is not breathing.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell happened?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What... Was it his wound?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: It’s this place! This place did something to him! William gives her an incredulous look.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What do you mean, this place? Annabelle puts her hand to her face, breathing deeply. Sh then lowers her hand and returns William’s gaze, her eyes hard. She speaks calmly.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Jeffy Hollister was in love with me, you know. William frowns, barely paying attention to her, as he lea forward and feels for a pulse in Sam’s neck.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Jeffy was in love with me. He used to say it all the time, before you got there. He hated you because of it. I could see it, William. He did. William looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: So what? Annabelle opens her mouth to answer William, then looks u the kitchen doorway. Todd is leaning against the door, ba able to support himself. William and Annabelle both stare at Todd, who stares back them.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Didn’t you... Didn’t you hear the screaming?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Todd, what are you talking about? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Todd stumbles over to the table and collapses into a chai He reaches forward for the bottle of whiskey, grabs it an drinks heavily. Todd’s eyes are glazed from fright.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: The screaming. Didn’t you hear it?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: We didn’t hear any screaming, Todd. Todd buries his face in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I think I’m going insane.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Why? What did you see? Todd grins, his eyes serious.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I don’t ever want to talk about that. Ever. Todd takes another drink. TODD (CONT’D) What’s the deal with Sam?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Sam’s dead, Todd. Todd looks over at Sam’s slumped form. He reaches out and touches Sam’s shoulder, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: How the hell did that happen? William steps forward, towards Todd.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I was wondering if you might know something about that. Todd looks at William, confused, then looks around the ro Realization dawns in Todd’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Don’t you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Todd looks around the room again, slowly.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Where’s the gold, William?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I don’t know, Todd. We left you watching it. Todd looks into William’s eyes. They stare at each other a moment. William’s gaze is locked on Todd, but William’s right han moving up towards his waistband, where his pistol is stuc

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: William? Todd kicks out at a chair, knocking the back of the chair into William’s waist. As William stumbles back, pulling o his pistol, Todd lunges across the table and grabs Sam’s from the holster on the side of Sam’s pants. Partly lying across Sam and the table, Todd has Sam’s pis cocked and aimed at William before William regain his balance. William freezes, looking at Todd. Todd is still slumped o Sam. He holds the gun aimed at William, regarding William with dead eyes. William’s gun is aimed uselessly at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Where’s the gold, William? The very tip of a scalpel blade gently enters the side of Todd’s neck, just under his earlobe. Todd goes stiff.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Two against one, Todd. What are you thinking about? Todd blinks, slowly.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I’11 kill him, Annabelle.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Maybe. He won’t be lonely long if you do. William remains still, holding Todd’s gaze. Todd sighs, t speaks with venom. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: You lousy, filthy, double-crossing bastards.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: You watch yourself, Todd. You’ve ridden with me for three years now. I’ve saved your life more times than I can count.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: That doesn’t make it yours.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: We don’t know where the gold is, Todd. we didn’t take it. You can check. (pause) Why don’t you put the gun down? Annabelle turns the scalpel slightly in Todd’s neck, lett a little more blood flow down into his collar. Todd shows visible reaction to this, though he is sweating.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: If you didn’t take the gold, who did?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: We left you watching it, Todd. Remember?

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I didn’t fucking take it. Where would I put it? Annabelle looks at William.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: We know you didn’t take it, Todd. An unaccompanied Negro with four bags of gold stands very little chance of getting through Texas. We know you wouldn’t try that. William blinks and does not look entirely convinced, but cautiously sticks his pistol back into his waistband, sti holding Todd’s gaze.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. Todd exhales slightly, then pushes the hammer on Sam’s pi back into place and places the pistol on the table. After moment, Annabelle tucks the scalpel back into her sleeve steps away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Todd slumps back into his chair, leaving the gun on the table. He puts his palms to his forehead and looks around room. After a long moment of silence, he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Well, I guess if you were planning to kill me and take the money, you would have just done it.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: You really don’t know what’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I know we’ve got bigger problems than that money. We need to get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I’m with you there. Todd frowns.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Where’s Clyde?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: He ran off into the cornfield a little while ago. I went looking, but I couldn’t find him. Todd slowly grows very still, looking around the room. He looks out the window, then looks back at William and Annabelle.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: (softly) Can you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: That voice. Can you hear it? William and Annabelle look at each other, then at Todd. TODD (CONT’D) You can’t hear it? Out there in the storm. It’s speaking right now. Listen. Todd cocks his head to the side, listens, then shakes his head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TODD (CONT’D) Now I can’t hear it. Now it’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Todd-

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: (sighs) Okay, let’s forget Clyde then, he’s gone. Let’s get on our horses and get the fuck out of here. Right now.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Without the gold? Todd looks into William’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Yes, without the gold.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: No way. Todd stands up, knocking his chair back.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I don’t care what you decide. I’m getting out of here. Todd grabs Sam’s pistol and the half-empty bottle of whis He looks at William. TODD (CONT’D) I’ll take these, if you don’t mind. Without another word, Todd storms out of the front room, through the front door. William and Annabelle look at eac other, then quickly head out after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd rapidly walks through the side yard, almost running through the rain. William and Annabelle hurry after him.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Todd! wait up! Todd does not slow his pace. William and Annabelle contin after him, towards the barn. Lightning flashes.  88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd, in the lead, comes to an abrupt stop in the entranc the barn. William and Annabelle almost collide with him.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What? Todd is silent. He stands in the entrance to the barn, hi shoulders heaving slightly. After a moment, William moves forward, standing next to Todd and looking into the barn. The horses have been shredded, their bodies ripped into s pieces that have been strewn all over the inside of the b The stacks of hay are splattered red with blood. Blood dr from several spots on the barn’s ceiling. One of the hors appears to have been bisected across its middle, and lies two halves directly in front of Todd. Annabelle involuntarily steps back from the sight.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Oh my god... Todd steps forward and picks up the severed leg of one of horses. The bloody end of it is ragged, with cracked bone sticking out of the flesh. Todd looks at the horse’s leg begins laughing quietly. William and Annabelle exchange a look. Todd glances at th then looks back at the mangled horses.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Looks like I’m walking. Todd glares at a horse’s severed head. The horse’s eyes a open, and its tongue sticks out of its mouth. TODD (CONT’D) What are you looking at? Todd throws the leg at the horse’s head, but misses. TODD (CONT’D) Ugly son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Todd. You alright?

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: No. I’m not. Todd turns away from William. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TODD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you’d seen what I saw, you’d know what’s going on here.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What did you see? Todd does not answer William, just walks further into the barn, gesturing angrily.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: You’d fucking know something, that’s for sure. William looks over at Annabelle.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: What could do this to the horses, William? It would... It would have to be the size of a bear...

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: (screaming) What the hell could do this to the horses, William? Todd points at William and Annabelle, his arm rigid. TODD (CONT’D) There are things that exist alongside us things that were once like us but just kept going, who live not in the places we know but in the spaces between them. Do you think it matters how big they are? There is a silence. Thunder rumbles. Todd pauses, lowerin his arm. TODD (CONT’D) Listen! Todd crouches down slightly. From no visible source, a VO begins speaking to Todd. The voice speaks softly, slurrin its words together.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: There were once others here, whose skin was like yours. The one whose skin was like theirs gave them to us. We enjoyed them very much. Are you tired? Todd turns to William and Annabelle, his face stricken. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Please... Please, William, Annabelle... Can you hear it? William looks at Annabelle, who shakes her head at Todd. looks around the barn, listening to the voice, shaking.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m up here. Todd looks up at the loft section of the barn. The loft i dark; nothing is visible there.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: It’s just the storm, Todd. Todd shakes his head. The voice continues speaking to him

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: (to Annabelle) It’s up in the loft...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: They call you Todd. (pause) The man brought us here so we would bring him back his wife. He gave us strength so we would help him. We liked that, but we could only bring parts of her back. Those weren’t enough for him. So we took parts of his children to make more of her. We understood him then. Todd squeezes his eyes shut, tears running down his face. begins swaying back and forth as the voice continues: VOICE (CONT’D) He didn’t like that either. And now we can’t go. Now this is where I live. (pause) Are you tired? Would you like to lie down here for a little while? Todd suddenly clamps his hands to his ears and screams:

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Stop talking! The voice is silent. Todd stares around the barn. William Annabelle are watching him. Todd looks back up at the lof Nothing is there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Todd... Do you want to leave now? Todd slowly lifts his hands up to his face. His eyes are

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I can’t trust my own eyes anymore, I think. Todd gestures at the horses. TODD (CONT’D) Did this... Did this really happen?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Come on. We’re going to get out of here. We’re going to leave this place.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: There’s worse things than dying, you know.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I know. Come on. Todd follows William and Annabelle outside of the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William, Annabelle and Todd stand by the well. William lo up into the rain. Todd reaches for the rope to the well’s bucket. He pulls it, trying to pull the rope up, but cannot. The bucket appears to be stuck on something. Frustrated, Todd throws down the rope, lifts his head to the sky and opens his mo drinking the rain.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: God damn this storm.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: The sooner we get out of here, the better.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What do we do about Sam?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: He’s dead, William. William is silenced for a moment (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I’d like to know who’s doing this to us, that’s all. If they’d just show themselves... Todd shakes his head, wiping the rain across his face.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I don’t think you want that at all.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Come on, William. William stares at Todd and Annabelle.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: You two seriously want to just leave here. Without our gold?

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: (shivering) Are you fucking kidding me? You want to look for the gold, William, that’s fine. I’m sure it’s somewhere around here. Good luck with that. I just want to get out of here and forget everything about this place. Then I’1l be happy forever. (pause) Shit. Annabelle puts her hand on William’s chest.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: We’ve got our guns. We can get more. William looks at her; she holds his gaze. Todd looks arou then walks past them, towards the front of the house. Aft Moment, Annabelle and William follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd, Annabelle and William reach the front yard. William stops, looking into the house.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Just let me... I need to go in and say goodbye to Sam. Annabelle nods. Todd looks around, quickly wiping rain of his face.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Hurry. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: William nods and walks into the front door of the house. moment later he steps out, lantern held aloft.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: He’s not here! Annabelle and Todd look at each other, quickly, then move towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam’s chair is empty. William, Todd and Annabelle look ar the deserted room.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: They took his body. Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What? Who did? Why would they do that?

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Lots of reasons. How should I know? Annabelle looks sharply at William.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Maybe... Maybe he’s not dead.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You checked for a pulse yourself, William.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Maybe I was wrong. Maybe I missed it.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: He looked pretty dead, man.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I could’ve been wrong. Maybe he just walked out of here.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: He didn’t look like he was about to start walking anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Well, he’s not here right now! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I agree with you there, William. And I think we should go. William looks at Annabelle, who slowly nods.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: He was dead, William. The infection from the bullet wound spread to his heart. Whoever took his body took it to keep us here. William looks at the floor, then looks outside.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: The first thing I’m gonna do when we get to Mexico is hire some guys and send them up here to burn this place to the fucking ground.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: That might not be such a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I don’t care. William walks out into the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd, Annabelle and William move over towards the cornfie When they reach the rows, William suddenly reaches down a picks an object up off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: It’s Sam’s shoe. William holds the leather boot out, for Annabelle and Tod see.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s got to be somewhere in the cornfield! Todd and Annabelle look at each other

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: We’ve got to head this way anyway.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Come on! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: William pushes his way into the cornfield, roughly shovin rows to the side. Todd and Annabelle move after him, alon the trail he is creating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William stumbles through the cornfield, Annabelle and Tod close behind him. Abruptly he stops, reaching another tra going through the cornfield.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: What’s this?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Another trail. William looks closely at the stump of a broken cornstalk. feels at it with his thumb.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Someone came through here recently.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Let’s just get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Come on. We have to head in this direction. William begins heading down the trail he has just discove his feet sinking slightly in the mud of the trail as he walks. Annabelle follows him. Todd looks around the cornfield, squinting against the ra After a moment, he follows Annabelle and William.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William and Annabelle stumble against the rain. Visibilit poor in front of them. They stagger into the clearing with the wooden cross. The form of the scarecrow is tied to the cross. William looks at the scarecrow, wiping rain from his eyes. Annabelle backs away, clearly terrified to be near the scarecrow.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Come on, William. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I could’ve sworn this is where we were before... Todd steps into the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Well, at least we’re headed in the right direction.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. Todd is looking up at the scarecrow intently. TODD (CONT’D) Something’s wrong. William squints up at the scarecrow, barely able to see through the rain. Just then, the scarecrow on the cross suddenly twists and emits a moaning sound. Todd, Annabelle and William all take a quick step away fr the cross. The scarecrow arches its back and twists again the ropes that are binding it to the cross.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (almost crying) Let’s go!

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: No, wait... Todd moves closer to the scarecrow. TODD (CONT’D) Clyde? The scarecrow’s body twists again, sharply. William steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: My god. Those are Clyde’s clothes.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Is it him? William looks at Todd. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Let’s find out. William hands his lantern to Annabelle. WILLIAM (CONT’D) Here. William carefully approaches the wooden cross, removing a knife from his boot. With the knife between his teeth, William climbs up the b of the cross, carefully avoiding contact with the scarecr which is no longer moving. Todd and Annabelle watch Willi anxiously. Todd has a hand on the butt of his gun. Using the knife, William begins cutting at the ropes wrap around the scarecrow’s body.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s tied up with hemp. Hold on a second. Todd moves closer to the scarecrow. The scarecrow writhes moans again. The moan is muffled by the burlap sack over head. Todd looks nervous.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hang on, Clyde. Don’t move so much, we’re cutting you loose. The scarecrow continues writhing. In a moment, William ha cut through the rope around the scarecrow’s right arm and torso. The scarecrow sways forward, then slips out of the remain ropes and falls forward off the cross. Todd reaches out t catch the scarecrow. The scarecrow hits Todd and they bot fall to the ground. William jumps off the cross and moves over to Todd, who r away from the scarecrow. Todd rises to his feet. The scarecrow twists miserably on the ground, as if barel able to move its body. Annabelle, William and Todd look d at it, hesitating.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here, hold on. William bends down and reaches for the burlap sack over t scarecrow’s head. Annabelle edges away. Todd surreptitiou reaches into his holster and removes his pistol, cocking (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: William pulls off the burlap sack, revealing Clyde’s face Clyde’s eyelids, mouth and nostrils have been sewn shut w black yarn. The flaps of Clyde’s ears have been sewn forw to the sides of his face. Clyde struggles to speak, pulli at the stitches on his mouth and eyes, but is only able t moan.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Oh my god. William and Todd stare at Clyde with horror. After a mome William leans forward with his knife, as if to cut the stitches on Clyde’s face. He hesitates near the yarn on Clyde’s mouth as Clyde writhes in pain.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Uh... Annabelle, do you have a scalpel or something in your bag?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. Annabelle begins fumbling through her satchel.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: We'd better use that. Todd leans forward to pluck some of the hay out of Clyde’ shirt, which is bloody in spots. Todd pauses, then feels lightly at Clyde’s chest.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Uh... Todd presses down on Clyde’s chest, hesitates, then pushe Clyde’s shirt. Clyde’s torso has been torn open and filled up with blood hay. Broken ribs poke up through the sides of Clyde’s tor as if his sternum was cracked away from his rib cage. Wad dried hay have been plunged into Clyde’s stomach and lung

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Oh. William staggers back a step, looking faint. Todd, as if unable to stop himself, pulls at Clyde’s sleeves. Clyde’s wrists have been slit, and hay has been shoved into the c Clyde continues to twist and moan on the ground as Todd checks his body. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: What... What did they do to him? William’s looks up at her, his face crumpling.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What is going on... Clyde suddenly stops moving, then his head slowly lolls t the side, to face Todd. With his stitched-shut lips and e Clyde smiles widely up at Todd. Todd recoils in fear.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: What the hell! Todd shoves at Clyde’s head. Clyde’s head immediately rol away from his body, into the rows of corn, out of sight. Clyde’s neck is a bloody stump, from which a few stalks o dried hay protrude. Clyde’s body lies still on the ground, hay sticking out o his clothes. Todd rises to his feet, shaking uncontrollably. William i still squatting, looking at Clyde’s body, in shock.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Come on, William. Get up. We need to go. Todd, still not looking at William or Annabelle, looks ar the cornfield.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: We’re never going to leave here.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Yes, we are, Todd. We’re going right now. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: No, we’re not. Todd’s mouth twists, as if he is about to cry. TODD (CONT’D) I don’t want to die here. I don’t want to have to stay here.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Come on, then. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Todd ignores Annabelle, looking around the cornfield. Jus beneath the sound of the wind whipping the cornstalks, several voices can be heard, whispering under the wind. T voices sound like those of small children. They babble ov each other, possibly in foreign tongues, their words impossible to understand. Annabelle watches Todd. Todd stands, transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Tell me you hear it now, Annabelle.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Hear what? (pause) I just hear the wind. Todd looks around.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: They say I’m next.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: No, you’re not, Todd. No one is. We’re getting out of here. William shakes his head and rises to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Come on, Todd. You’re hearing things. It’s just the storm. Todd shakes his head slightly. The voices grow louder ove the wind, becoming urgent and angry.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: (softly) No, it isn’t. Todd steps forward, towards the cornfield, almost stumbli over Clyde’s body. Todd looks down at Clyde’s body, his f stiffening. Todd then looks up, clear-eyed, and addresses cornfield:

dialogues.speaker: TODD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You may not let me leave here, but I won’t let you take me. With that, Todd places the barrel of his pistol in his mo cocking the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Todd! No! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Todd pulls the trigger. The round bullet sends blood and fragments spurting out of the back of Todd’s head. Todd stays upright for a moment, looking dazed, then bloo flows from his open mouth and he crumples to the ground, dead. William stands above Todd, astonished. Todd’s body lies n to Clyde’s. Annabelle grabs at William’s arm, pulling at

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Come on! William mutely follows her further into the cornfield. Annabelle begins to run; William follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabelle and William rush through the cornfield, occasionally slipping in the mud, with Annabelle in the l Annabelle is running intently through the corn. William staggers after her, trying to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Slow down!

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Come on! Annabelle continues rushing forward, through the cornstal The wind and rain whips into her face, and the cornstalks being blown back towards her. Behind her, William slips and falls, flat on his face, in mud. He struggles to his feet, slips and falls back down again. Grabbing onto the cornstalks, William hauls himsel upright and stumbles forward again. He can no longer see Annabelle; she is too far ahead. Wil runs forward, in her general direction.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Annabelle! William’s words are drowned out by a sudden clap of thund He plunges forward, through the cornstalks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabelle continues racing forward, still lighter on her than William. She runs through the dark cornfield, shouti out: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: We’ve got to be near the road by now! There is no response from behind her. Still running, Annabelle looks over her left shoulder. There is nothing behind her but cornstalks. She comes to a stop, looking b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William continues running, looking around. Inside the cornfield, it is impossible to determine what direction h headed in. Winded, William slows to a stop, looking around. He is surrounded on all sides by thick cornstalks.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (screaming) Annabelle! There is no response. William gasps for air, looking arou

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabelle puts her hands to her mouth and shouts, trying be heard over the rain.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: William! There is no response from the cornfield. Annabelle takes step forward, moving deeper into the cornfield, then stop looking behind her, in the general direction of the trail ANNABELLE (CONT’D) Come on, William... Where are you? Annabelle shifts her feet nervously, her eyes wide with f unwilling to move in either direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deeper in the cornfield, William catches his breath.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Annabelle! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: William looks around, then takes a step forward and freez A few feet to William’s right, a dark figure is just visi moving in the cornstalks. The figure immediately disappea obscured by the cornstalks.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Annabelle? William moves in the direction of the figure, peering for anxiously. Suddenly, a child’s giggle comes from directly behind William. William stops moving and stands very still. He slowly mov his right hand onto the butt of his pistol, staring strai ahead into the cornfield. In a sudden motion, William spins around, drawing his pis out in front of him. No one is there. William takes a ste back, brandishing his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who’s there? In the cornstalks directly in front of William, in a spac between two haphazard rows, the figure briefly appears ag passing between the rows. The figure’s body is lumpy and large and the figure is wearing a hat; it is clearly not Annabelle, but it is too dark to see any further details before the figure moves behind another row of corn. William cocks the hammer on his pistol, nervously moving forward, looking around as he does so. He whispers, almos himself:

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Annabelle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabelle looks around again, then clenches her jaw and begins moving forward, deeper into the cornfield.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: William!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William looks around, shielding his eyes from the rain. Lightning flashes, followed immediately by thunder. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A wild animal cry comes from the cornstalks near William. cornstalks move, as if something small is running through them. William jumps, twisting his gun towards the direction of sound. Nothing is visible in the cornstalks. A low, gentl human sobbing softly comes from the cornstalks near Willi William’s face fills with fear.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Who’s out there? There is no response, and the sobbing noise gradually fad away. William looks around. Lightning flashes, and, ten feet away from William in the cornfield, the figure of a scarecrow is visible. The scarecrow pushes its way through the cornstalks, angrily making its way through the field, towards the house. As William stares at the scarecrow, the scarecrow suddenl stops moving and turns its head towards William. The scarecrow has no eyes or face, just a burlap sack. The scarecrow and William face each other, frozen, then the scarecrow cocks its head slightly. The lightning ends and the field is immediately dark agai the scarecrow is no longer visible. William quickly raise his gun and fires towards the direction of the scarecrow. gunshot echoes through the field. There is no response from the section of the cornfield William just aimed at. William pauses for a moment, stari ahead, then quickly breaks his pistol and begins urgently reloading it, looking in front of himself while doing so. William’s hands are shaking so badly that he can barely l his pistol, but he finally manages to do so, instantly cocking his pistol again and holding it out in front of h He looks around the field, backing up. In front of William, the cornstalks move to the side; the dark figure of the scarecrow is briefly visible passing through the stalks, towards William. William points his g at the figure, but does not fire as the figure immediatel disappears from view. William’s lower jaw is trembling, and he breathes in shor gasps. WILLIAM (CONT’D) Shit... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A splashing sound comes from William’s other side; he spi around, aiming his pistol in this direction, his hand shaking. Just then, a howling noise, like that of an anim in pain or dying, comes from in front of William; he twis in that direction with a sharp cry. From behind William, a dark figure suddenly bursts throug the cornstalks, moving directly towards William’s back. William spins around, stumbling away, and immediately fir at the dark figure. The figure instantly comes to a stop, then takes a step backwards and falls back in between two stalks of corn, unmoving. The figure lies still on the ground, shrouded b the darkness of the cornfield. Only the figure’s shoes ar visible. William falls to his knees in front of the figure, sobbin hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun’s first rays shine over the cornfield. The rain h ceased, though the cornstalks are still damp in appearanc The morning light is faint, but illuminates the entire cornfield. William is still sitting in the mud. Annabelle’s body lie front of him. Her eyes are shut. The blood on her forehea has congealed and is almost black around the bullet wound where William shot her. William stares straight ahead, his face blank. His hair i pasted to his head. He looks aimlessly into the cornfield

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cornfield is now bright with the morning sun. William still sitting next to Annabelle, staring straight ahead. then turns his head and looks at Annabelle. Reaching out, William puts his hand to the side of Annabelle’s face. His jaw trembles, then he takes his han away, looks away from Annabelle’s corpse and rises to his feet. William’s gun lies several feet away from him, half-burie the mud. William moves towards the rows of corn, then fre as a sudden growling sound comes from directly in front o him. William looks down slowly, his body still. Dog is standin front of William, between two haphazard rows of corn. (CONTINUED)
